result.execSummary:
The defendant Gino Steven Bilot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming. Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; random urine screens.
No contact with Michael R.  No contact with UWM Campus unless enrolled in that institution.
Obtain/maintain employment.  Obtain GED/HSED.  Complete any educational or employment opportunities.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, pay DNA analysis surcharge and pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections. Court ordered restitution set at zero. Complete Anger Management program.

Court informed defendant he may petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of probation, that he must not have any new charges rising to probable cause and have completed ALL conditions of probation with no sanctions or violations.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed to be used by the agent for violating any conditions of probation:  5 days for the 1st violation; 10 days for the 2nd violation; 20 days for the 3rd violation; 40 days for the 4th violation and so until used up or revoked.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gino Steven Bilot

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:   09-30-2014      Initials:  AAC

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 5 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed to be used by the agent for violating any conditions of probation:  5 days for the 1st violation; 10 days for the 2nd violation; 20 days for the 3rd violation; 40 days for the 4th violation and so until used up or revoked.
- AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
- The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Random urine screens.
- No contact with Michael R.
- No contact with UWM Campus unless enrolled in that institution.
- Complete Anger Management program.
- Complete 50 hours of community service.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Complete any educational or employment opportunities.
- Court ordered restitution set at zero.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court informed defendant he may petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of probation, that he must not have any new charges rising to probable cause and have completed ALL conditions of probation with no sanctions or violations.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Gino Steven Bilot in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 21
Amended Information received and filed.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to BATTER, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Gino Steven Bilot in court with Attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Branch 21 in jury trial on an unrelated matter.  Defense request for adjournment granted.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gino Steven Bilot in court with Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Benjamin Lindsay for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gino Steven Bilot in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Dennis P. Murphy, appearing for Megan Carmody, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated March 11, 2014 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Michael R. or Sandburg Commons, 3410 N. Maryland Ave., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Gino Steven Bilot in court with Zachariah Fudge appearing under the student practice rule and under the supervision of attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Gino Steven Bilot in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
